comments:
Mylar 0.4.2.1, Eclipse 3.2M3, Java 1.5.0_03.

I am using a plain Bugzilla 2.16.3 installation over HTTPS with HTTP auth. When
I go to "Add Bugzilla Query", the form is blank; so I click on the "Update
Products" button, which connects (it asks for my user name/pw) and then does
nothing. From the Apache log:

x.x.x.x - alex [15/Nov/2005:15:40:05 -0500] "GET
/cgi-bin/bugzilla/index.cgi/query.cgi?GoAheadAndLogIn=1&Bugzilla_login=...&Bugzilla_password=...
HTTP/1.1" 200 4213 "-" "Java/1.5.0_03"

That's the only request made. Nothing in Eclipse's error log.

If I use "Add Existing Bugzilla Report", I get this:

And the web server log says the same thing as above.

In the Mylar -> Bugzilla preferences did you change the version to 2.16?  It
defaults to 2.20.  The error handling needs to be improved.

I won't be able to test this without a public 2.16 repository that's accessible.
 Do you know of one?

I've fixed the failing code to do a check that prevents the out of bounds, but
that may not resolve the issue.
Thanks, should have tried that myself.
I just realized that Mylar was using the wrong URL. I had entered "http://.../cgi-bin/bugzilla/index.cgi" as the URL; removing the "/index.cgi" part made it work.
Excellent.  So do you think it would suffice if the URL format was documented on the prefs page?
